to improve the water environment
after launching the raft, polluted canals
have become cleaner.
Each aquatic raft is 4 m long and 2 m wide and
is made of plastic pipes or frames.  The pond
contains 40 to 60 aquatic plants. The rafts are placed
about 20 m apart. Aquatic plants
purify home water. The stem and roots act
as filters, transferring pollutants into the
plant's biomass and supplying oxygen to the
water.  An idea that is very
welcome and needs to be replicated throughout the
economic system of Ho Chi
Minh City. Besides, dill also brings
economic value in that we can
harvest the Chrysanthemum plant.  to sell to
flower shops so that people can
buy flowers for holidays. Aquatic rafts
are mobile when the water rises and
falls, and when the water is low, the water is stored in the roots
to help the plant not be affected when the water rises.
Plants continue to grow, the cost of
investing in making aquatic rafts is not much,
quick and can be used for 3 to
4 years. Aquatic rafts are considered a
suitable friendly solution to improve
polluted canals

Climate change and detrophy are causing the

they sink to the seabed and are attacked by bacteria.
